description:
L&G sits in the Tenderloin, which is a bit sketchy, but the banh mi is worth it. 

It's not the cleanest, or the most spacious, but it is what it is, a hole in the wall. There's only one employee (an older Vietnamese man) on site but he really spent his time making the sandwich, I did appreciate that aspect rather than the assembly line style of making the sandwich.

On to the banh mi itself, they had a sizable array of sandwiches but I chose the BBQ pork banh mi. The baguette does not appear to be made on site but it is toasted in an oven which ensures that the overall sandwich (meat, carrots, cilantro, daikon, and jalapeno) is nice and hot when you eat it. I really liked that.

For $4 this sandwich was well worth it I would be happy to come back to L&G. They even offer a punch card!
author: David D.

description:
Yes, this is truly a "Hole in the wall" and the neighborhood is a bit "sketchy", but it's worth it.

It's not the "cleanest" hole in the wall, but the food is "Hot, Fresh and seriously made with Love".

I believe this little gem has only been open about 3 years. But the gal who prepares it all has been in the restaurant business about 35 years. She knows her way around a True Vietnamese Sandwich".

Saigon Sandwich just around the corner is also an institution, but really, this is BETTER !!!!

I was torn between the chicken and the pork so she gave me a split with a little of each meat. The bun was grilled perfectly. It was Hot, Hot, Hot, so you know the meat is turned regularly, keeping the perfect temperature. There was so much meat, it spilled out of the sandwich, along with the carrots, cilantro and daikon. I had to get a spoon to scoop up all this goodness. Oh and I think I used about a dozen small napkins, it was That Good !

All this yumminess for $4.00 and a bag of chips for $1.00 + tip = $6.00.
Tell me, where can you get a fulfilling, hot, yummy sandwich in this town for $4.00. Only Here !!!!!  Plus they do a punch card, get 10, get the 11th Free.

Truly folks, don't go anywhere else for your Vietnamese Sandwich, as NOTHING will top this goodness.

Plus the ladies are so darn sweet, you just want to hug them at the end of your meal.
author: Marla B.

description:
Hole in the wall in the Tenderloin with better sandwiches than Saigon. Rolls are always just crunchy enough. Best food in sf for under five bucks. 

Take care getting there and back. This is a neighborhood you don't want to be walking around staring at your phone.
author: Larry W.

description:
This is my go-to spot for Bahn Mi.
I work about 15 minutes away and the trip is soooo worth it. They even have a loyalty card!
author: Tom S.

description: Tested out the special combo banh mi from both here and Saigon Sandwich and came to the conclusion that the sandwich here was yummier! The bread, filling and price here beats SS but I must give props to the sauce they used at SS. BTW CHECK OUT MY FOOD IG @FOODYJENNY
author: Jenny N.

description:
Tenderloin has an abundance of Vietnamese restaurants in-fact there are as many as 4 specialized Banh-Mi (sandwiches) restaurants. Saigon Sandwich and L&G Vietnamese Sandwich are two that are literally across from each other. After trying out Saigon Sandwich, I decided to give L&G Vietnamese Sandwich a try.

This is another small primarily to-go restaurant, but I think it has a couple of seats inside. At the peak lunch hour on Saturday it looked like they had just opened and there were a couple of people standing inside waiting for something. I did the same. After about 10 minutes of so they started taking orders. I think they were waiting for the bread or protein, can't be sure. Anyway the menu again is pretty simple a couple of different types of sandwiches including BBQ pork, BBQ chicken, meatball combination etc. Most of the sandwiches are around the $4 mark with tax.

I got the BBQ Chicken sandwich and soon was on my way. The sandwich was neatly packed but it was haphazardly put together. The French roll was not crunchy and the chicken had a weird smell. Overall this was an average sandwich.

I decided to give L&G another try but this time found that they had been closed due to a health code violation. That's when I decided no more tries, I'm sticking with Saigon sandwich which is just across the road.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
I went to both this place and Saigon Sandwich across the intersection and i must say that they are both good.  This shop was operated by one lady who is really really sweet. 

I got a BBQ pork sandwich and I enjoyed the taste and the rolls were fresh as well.  I can't really say that one is clearly better than the other I would probably go to the one that had the smaller line.
author: Rod M.

description: This is a solid banh mi spot! It's a small shop in the Tenderloin manned by one older man who makes your banh mi fresh on toasted bread, with juicy meat options (bbq chicken was good) and an abundance of pickled carrots/radishes. Really nothing to complain about aside from the sketchier surrounding area, and to expect about a 5-10 minute wait while your sandwich is made. Get the stamp card for a free sandwich on the 10th one!
author: Regina X.

description:
Had the Special Combination. Liked the meats & abundant vegetables & jalapenos. The bread could have been fresher--it was more hard than crunchy. 

It took quite a while for the order even though it wasn't busy and there were three people behind the counter. The lady was trying to make the sandwich one-handed. Impressive, given the whole time, she had to maintain a phone conversation, give instructions to the cashier, and relay the phone messages to what appeared to be her son, who was sitting, busy with his own phone.
author: David W.

description:
Little Vietnamese sandwich shop in the Tenderloin I usually get my bahn mi from, I discover also makes a wonderful spicy beef soup, but only on weekends. If want it to go (and brave enough to get out of your car) the sweet owners will pack it up for you in 3 parts.
The base, the noodles, and the fresh whole herbs so it taste fresh and your can customize it to your liking. Said by many to be the best around. [And that's a tall order in that hood]
This huge portion big enough for two. $11.
author: John W.

description:
I was picking-up some Banh Mi at Saigon Sandwich to drop off at work one glorious weekend and happened to notice this other Banh Mi joint across the street. I've never seen L&G before, but it's been a while since I've been to this part of town so the following weekend, we returned and got our fix at Saigon Sandwich, and also proceeded to L&G to try out their Banh Mi for comparison. 

**Warning** 

Depending on what part of Larkin you are on, you might need some respiratory mask to get there since the stench of urine is overpowering along with used needles strewn everywhere on the sidewalk so better be careful where you walk.

After passing that gauntlet, I walked inside and their menu was posted on the wall on top of the counter for everyone to see. The menu is simple and I ordered a Combination and BBQ Pork to go. There were three other people in front of me waiting for their order, but I didn't have to wait too long once they started my order. 2 orders of Banh Mi sammiches for under $8 is a bargain. 

I returned back to the car and Wifey and I drove to Fort Point to enjoy our sammiches with a view. (Note: We also ordered the same types of sammiches from Saigon Sandwich for comparison as this was some serious scientific data that we were dealing with.) 

So, we tried both their Combination and BBQ Pork and they were good. We were not particularly wowed by the taste, but it was better than decent. But for the price point, it's definitely worth it. The size is decent, the ingredients are fresh and the portion is appropriate. They don't skimp on anything, but since we were comparing sammiches, they were behind in flavor and sauce compared to Saigon. 

Overall, a decent meal for a good value that's easy on the wallet.

Solid 3 1/2 stars.
author: John G.

description:
First of all the value is unbeatable. One of the very very important thing to me is value. I believe this is one of the cheaper, if not the cheapest banh mi place around here. $3.75 for 1, after 10 banh mi you get the 11th FREE. If you're a banh mi fiend like me you'd get to your 11th pretty instantaneously.

Anyhoodle. Tastewise it is not the best. I am utterly spoiled for being back in VN for a whole month recently and almost every morning I had a banh mi in my face. So this is not as good. It's also not as good as Ba Le in Boston, nor the various bm places in Houston. But for SF it's actually pretty good. I actually -PREFER- their special combo here to Saigon Sandwiches. 

Firstly when I'm not in VN, my go-to banh mi is the special combo. 
What I want: generous heaping of pate, good meat to veg ratio, perfect toasted banh mi (real real baguette)
What I get here: lil bit of pate, meat and veg overload - like soooo much stuffing it cannot be contain in one simple vessel, and not the exact baguette style I'm use to. I mean it's not bad bread per say but it's not your typical banh mi (traditionally). The bread is more toasty, harder than tradition. To many others they probably enjoy it and doesn't mind but I'm a bit obsess with banh mi so I'm a tad disappointed. Meatwise I find that pinkish ham to be endearing, it taste good, I don't mind it. It have a good bit of crunchy cartilage really add some character to your banh mi. 

So their special combo get a 3.5* for LOTS of meat and veggies, lil pate, but not my fav bread

BBQ Pork is meh. Unfortunately it to me a bit of a one-note. You get very bored of it very quickly. Can not finish the whole banh mi (THAT IS NOT TYPICAL FOR ME). It was my fault because when I think of BBQ Pork I thought of : CRISPY PORK (a beautiful banh mi movement in VN currently) something I can never be bored of. This is not that. Again normal people probably digs it though. 2/5

Vietnamese Coffee: combo with any banh mi = cheaper, forgot how much but CHEAP. Don't worry about it. I'm not a coffee drinker, I like my VN Coffee flooded with Condense milk. I guess regular coffee people would like this but I had to put like a bucket (not literally) of condense milk when I got home. LOL I'm pathetic (?)

Normal, quick service. In and out for your banh mi in t-minus 5 minutes. Never any sort of wait. 

Biggest dilemma was is this a 3 or a 4 star. For SF standard it's a 4 or above, I mean I'm trying many different banh mi places where this one may not taste the absolute best (of SF) but the value is so incredible it will be my go to banh mi place.  (TBH still better tasting and better value than Saigon Sandwich tho ~) But for my true core obsession with banh mi and my very peculiar taste per say it's a 3 star.
author: Quynh Nhu D.

description:
I was amped to check out this spot after reading the review of East Bay Elite yelper John B.

Excellenct and affordable Banh mi sandwiches at this hole in the wall in the Tenderloin.

For vegans check out the marinated tofu Banh mi sandwich that comes with jalapeno, marinated tofu, and veggies such as shredded carrot along with cilantro. For vegans make sure to ask for the sandwich without mayo.

A refreshing drink would be great to have the nectar from a young coconut as the cook will chop off the top for you giving you a straw and will also chop the coconut in half so you can enjoy the meat afterwards like I often did in my trips abroad in India.

Another option for vegans is the spring rolls as they can do tofu and veggies for vegan spring roll yet please know that the peanut sauce for dipping comes with chicken stock so vegans best get soy sauce or sriracha.

Great spot and friendly service yet don't come here with a crowd as there is limited seating. I will be back soon :-)
author: Shane S.

description: Not the #1 best banh mi in the City, but good. And it's right near the BART and Ferry Bldg, so it's a place I frequent when I need a quick cheap and tasty sandwich.
author: Brian B.

description: This place always keep my happy and full. I order a tofu banh mi and bring my hibiscus tea from Daiso. Great combo for sunny breezy days.
author: Wesley K.

description:
I think the low health score may be due to casual housekeeping... a dish of papayas ripening on the floor, a kitchen cabinet recycled as a food staging area etc... rather than anything to worry about.  Reminds me of my own kitchen actually. It's also a charming hole-in-the-wall with some instructional Marvel-comics type drawings to study while you wait.

As to the food, I always get the special combination plus barbecued pork for variety. The latter is usually an afterthought but here it was one of the best bahn mi I've ever eaten... sweet, fatty, redolent of five-spice seasoning, with a generous complement of pickled carrot, daikon and jalapeño (i ordered extra spicy). The special combo, on the other hand, was nothing special, with mild pork roll and pate.

L&G is on the opposite corner of Eddy & Larkin from Saigon Sandwich, so if you are in no hurry (or if you're on your way to the airport at 10 am like me) you can get your dac biet at Saigon and barbecue pork here. Or try one of their other sandwiches which is what I'm going to go since I picked up a frequent diner card and have eight more stamps to collect.
author: Otis M.

description: Cheap banh mi sandwiches that are packed with meat, pickled radishes+carrots and jalapeños! The bun is toasted and crunch. Delicious hole in the wall!
author: Diana J.

description:
There are several places in the neighborhood to grab a cheap sandwich should the urge strike you. Lee's around the corner, Balo, and most notably Saigon Sandwich. 

That is there are plenty of choices if you eat meat. If you don't, your options are severely limited. Saigon doesn't offer a Vegetarian sandwich. Lee's dry shredded tofu is a piss poor alternative. Balo is okay but not in the same league as the new kid on the block. 

While L&G ain't all that new, it is new to me. When SF Vegan Elite Lanie L. shared a photo of her banh mi, I was like damn that's what I've been missing!

I ordered up the tofu sandwich without mayo. I wasn't sure what to expect. When the lady handed me my warm toasty banh mi I was in for a treat. It survived the 15 minute drive back to the office and was still nice and warm when I unwrapped it. Soft, yet crunchy bread. Crispy and fresh veggies with just the right amount of tang. She went buckwild when I excitedly said yes to jalapenos. The tofu however is what makes this banh mi special. It's not even really soft tofu as I was expecting. It's more of a faux meat if anything. Whatever it is, it makes a helluva sandwich.

I've tried banh mi from just about everywhere in SF and nobody makes it quite like this. For $3.50 you cannot beat it anywhere! It's also much more hearty than I remember the competition being. When I used to eat Saigon, I always needed to supplement with something else. This good sized sandwich needed no supplementation. 

There was no line when I arrived at lunch time. Unlike certain places around here I was not rushed to order. You can also order online and pick up at your convenience. There's even a stamp card should you plan to become a regular here. The service was good and less hectic, and there is even a table or two should you want to savor your sando here, rather than being harassed outside by all the drug addicts. 

Sure they may have a sketchy health score but who cares! It adds to the appeal. I'd rather pay $3.50 for an actually Vegan banh mi from a hole in the wall instead of $8 from a fancier, cleaner establishment.
author: John B.

description: Damn good sandwich! I tried all their sandwiches before making a review, and they are all delicious !! Surprisingly the tofu packs a ton of flavor! Price is great and ice coffee is super strong and tasty!
author: Timothy W.

description: Honestly one of the best sandwiches I've had ever - not just Bahn Mi - literally one of the best sandwiches, bar none. Can't wait to go back.
author: Enrique P.

description:
Great sandwiches!  
Make sure they toast the baguette!
Small local shop specializing in Vit Namese style sandwiches! Their baguette (like you get in Vit Nam) is the real deal, not like Lee's or SaiGon across the way!
Maybe too much carrot though, needs more daikon & cilantro I think!
Can't beat the price either!
author: Dan S.

description: Great Vietnamese sandwiches for an incredible price! The sandwiches are toasted, the veggies feel fresh and the meats are cut up so you don't pull out half your sandwich with a bite! The sandwiches are also made right in front of you and it's very fast.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Alright.. I will be honest here. I literally came here because the line at Saigon Sandwich was too long. The Auntie who works here is super SUPER sweet too which is a huge added plus! The vibe here kinda felt like my mom making me a sandwich at home if that makes any sense.

Ordered the combo - Sandwich was really good was about 50-75 cents cheaper than their competition next door. Bread was toasted, veggies plentiful, and meat also plentiful. 

The only reason why I am giving this place 4 stars is how the place seemed to not follow health codes. (Food left out) (Garbage exposed/not taken out)  The low health score almost deterred me from trying it out, but I am glad I did. Super yummy and I definitely did not get sick!
author: Eleana H.

description: The best bahn mi anywhere. Couldn't stop thinking about this place while in Vietnam and eating bahn mi in Vietnam. Perfect balance of pickled veggies, meat and deliciousness. Can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches here. I'm a faithful customer for sure!
author: J P.

description: This was my first time ever trying Vietnamese sandwiches but for a first impression, the taste was pretty good. The staff was really friendly, and the iced coffee was great only they used a lot of ice. The restaurant is awfully small, more designed for take-out but there were just enough chairs for the 3 of us to enjoy our sandwiches. The bathroom was also small, and doubled as their storage room. The sink was a little hard to use because of the trash receptacles and mop bucket in the way. There was a bug trap on the paper towel dispenser and there were visible roaches stuck on the trap..
author: Alyssa F.

description: Phenomenal food for an unbelievable price relative to every other restaurant in San Francisco. The Bahn Mi is crazy good! The only reason this isn't 5 stars is because of the awful neighborhood it's located in. If you're willing to feel like you're life is at risk for a brief outing, I'd highly recommend going to the Tenderloin to grab a sandwich.
author: Jake B.

description:
I wanted to try ordering Vietnamese sandwiches from a different place. This is around the Lee's Sandwiches and Saigon sandwiches area, so it's very noticeable and convenient. 

-Sandwiches are priced reasonably. I ordered a combination sandwich for $3.75. Also, if you use card there's a $10 minimum, unless you want to pay the $0.50 fee.

-The sandwiches here hold a distinct taste and are unique compared to other Vietnamese sandwich stores. 

If you're in the area then it's worth it to check this place out. I like how they have a stamp card as an incentive, once you get 10 stamps you qualify for a free sandwich.
author: Erica K.

description:
Their sandwich is average. At $4.25 for a combo it kinda skimps on the meat and adds a lot of pickled carrots which over power the other flavors. If I wanted a pickled carrot sandwich I'd come here, otherwise there are a lot of other places in the area.

At least the Jalapeno's we're fresh and spicy.
author: joe H.

description:
Aaron, thanks for your reply.  I speak Cantonese to the nice lady every time, she hustles and gets things done fast.  Mad respect.  

I order at least 2-3 Sandos for myself and friends each time, but I don't want a stamp card.  I'm happy to pay full price and tips for totally awesome food.  





I don't usually order meatball banh mi but this is the best ever.  Dirty dirty in a F"ing good way.  Add Extra pate and jalapeños.  It's heaven paired well with a dry brut sparkling, lol.
author: Kevin L.

description:
A cockroach nymph just crawled out of my sandwich. 

While all of my previous orders from L&G have been delicious, there are some experiences one just can't get over.
author: James M.

description: Food was fantastic and incredibly cheap. Had the BBQ pork. Quite nice to be full off of 4 dollars flat from great food with fresh ingredients.
author: Nathan L.

description:
I read the story about this little family restaurant last night on SF Chronicles and I was touched by their story. I decided I need to check this place out. I checked Yelp to see the reviews and notice a sign with bad health inspection score, which made me feel kind of skeptic to try it out. The reviews look good though and I see a friend's post praising how great the sandwiches and friendly the owner treats their customer. 

My go-to banh mi is always been Saigon Sandwich and today I wanted to try something different for a change. I notice that L&G Vietnamese Sandwich was diagonal across from Saigon Sandwich. I went in around late afternoon and came in to ordered two combos with no pepper and one chicken sandwich. It was an affordable price for $3.75 for one and you get a stamp card for free after you buy 10 sandwiches. The wait was about 5-10 minutes, not too long. The owner put the sandwiches in the bag and I gave them cash. When I got back home, I notice all my sandwiches are all combo and the only one is without pepper. They must have switch the order with the couple in front of me because I ordered one chicken and two combos with no pepper.... :(( I was hungry, so I did not really care much. The combo was pretty good like any other combo I ate. There wasn't much MSG that made feel thirsty afterward like most banh mi sandwiches, so that's a plus. A lot of stuffing of veggies with carrots, daikon, cucumber, and etc and a good portion of pork stuff in the sandwich. 

If there is something I would fix about the store is the interior design to be more print letters (instead of handwritten like Chipotle Pulled Pork and Broiled Pork...and the price for other things) and fix the broken crack on the door would be nice :) Or change the interior to be more minimalistic for better health inspection score...  I guess it's the home feeling when you walk into a mom&pop restaurant.
author: Judy M.

description: I found out about this place on accident because Saigon Sandwich was closed but I'm so glad that I did :-) their sandwiches are pretty dank and they're always super friendly even when they're packed!!!!
author: Latashia G.

description:
Picked it up the night before a flight back to Toronto cause plane food sucks and it's kind of a tradition. 

Got the tofu and Grilled pork. 4 ppl serving us at at the same time ^_^ 

Second day not heated up and the bread was still crusty and the marinate on the tofu with the fresh chili and pickled veggies were a match made in heaven!

;) they also have a loyalty card!
author: Jannies L.

description: The Vietnamese sandwiches here are simply amazing and only $4!!! It's nestled in the heart of the most disgusting "hood" I've ever worked in and doesn't look like the greatest place but don't judge this book by its cover! There are awards on the wall for cleanliness which I truly appreciate. The selection is quite small but it's really really good
author: Bryan P.

description:
My go-to lunch spot! Staff are always quick and courteous, and food is always delicious. I go for the chicken banh mi, and shrimp spring rolls if I need a snack too. The chicken is never dry, and they are generous with ingredients. For under $5 for a sandwich, it's perfect.

The Thai tea with boba is delicious too - boba is good and chewy! I'll probably keep with this spot, even with the assortment of banh mi spots close by.
author: Neda S.

description:
They accept cards with $10 minimum! Pick up a business card because they're now doing frequent buyer stamps. Buy 10 sandwiches, get 1 free!

The lady who runs this place does it all on her own, and she's a total sweetheart. Love their pate! I always order a combo with no cilantro. The owner always remembers!
author: Susy C.

description: the combo sandwich is toasted, warm, fresh and tasty.  the store owner is very friendly.  I had a good time, relaxed and it is like a little get away, no need to think about my office.  Make sure you pick up your card to get your buy 10 get 1 free sandwich.  will go again.
author: P Y.

description:
FINALLY my search for the most perfect Banh Mi in the city of San Francisco has ended. I took the 38 bus and walked 7 minutes in the pouring rain to get here. L&G is HANDS DOWN The BEST. Unfortunately, I work in the FiDi so traveling here not fun at all.  I've had other sandwiches in the city that don't even come close to how delicious L&G makes their sammys. The perfect proportion of meat, perfect veggies, and perfect bread! One down side is the bread does still scratch the top of my mouth, but you can take a bite of the sandwich easily without struggling because of its crispyness. 

I want another one already!
author: Emi K.

description: Great fast service top sandwich under 4 dollars for most and they take Credit card 10 dollars minimum or 50 cent charge FYI
author: Luke W.

description: Excellent service! I told them that I don't like mayo in my sandwich, and they immediately started giving me a bunch of alternative options. They are very kind and attentive to their customers' needs.
author: A90 G.

description:
The special combo banh mi ($3.75) reminded me of Boston banh mi back when I was little but souped up with jalapeño, pickled veggies, and more meat. 

It definitely is a second to Saigon Sandwiches even though it is open later (Saigon Sandwiches closed at 5pm Sunday despite the signs saying 5:30pm) and cheaper by $0.75  because the meat used isn't as meaty or real. 

L & G uses the usual salami like meat with the fatty parts and peppercorns, the paté isn't as tasty or appealing, and the white meat has the tinge of red on the edges from the seasoning, which was interesting. Also, the sauce and mayo used didn't quite complement the sandwich as a whole. 

Still tasty, definitely hits home for me because the ingredients used remind me of when I was young, but unfortunately doesn't cut it as the best banh mi because Saigon Sandwiches uses ingredients that are, in my opinion, much better and tastier.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Exceptional service!

My friend and I stopped in for a quick lunch. We ordered at the counter and then sat down. The sandwiches were delivered to us toasted and packed with pickled veggies and chicken. The mayo wasn't overpowering nor flowing all over the place. 

I really enjoyed the flavor of the chicken. It's a bit more barbecued/grilled? A teeny bit spicy. Loved it. I've only had their Vietnamese ice coffee before, but I bet the sandwich and coffee combo would be stellar. 

Chicken Banh Mi is only $4. It's a good sized sandwich too, not diminished in size, value and taste as Saigon Sandwich
author: Elisabeth H.

description: After a long day, my friend I enjoyed baguettes from this little shop. The chipotle sandwich was to die for--it was well-packaged and full of flavor! The shopkeepers were stern, yet efficient.
author: David V.

description:
I'd been craving Vietnamese sandwiches. While waiting for the bus on the way home, I remembered L&G was right off the 31 Balboa. Hopped on the bus on Thursday, August 6th and got to L&G a little before 6pm. Grabbed some take out for dinner.

Vietnamese sandwich:
*Special combination ($3.50)
*BBQ chicken ($3.25): add Pate

I loved the special combination. Lots of pate which I adored. I added pate to the chicken sandwich as well. I don't believe they charged me for it as I only paid $6.75 altogether. Both sandwiches were delicious! The bread soft, but with a nice crusty chew. The veggies were pickled nicely and the peppers had a nice kick. I wanted to try some spring rolls as well, but I think they were out as I didn't see any.

Great place to drop by and fulfill my banh mi craving. Cash only.
author: Elena N.

description:
I was craving a meatball banh mi, and the line at Saigon Sandwich across the street was just too long, so I ventured over to L&G and I'm so happy that I did. The store was not crowded at all, and the family that runs it is super friendly. The mom makes the sandwiches and her son is the cashier.  

The meatball bahn mi is probably one of the best I've ever had. The bread was very crispy, and the pork meatballs were piping hot and were moist and tender. The sandwich was topped by a heaping pile of pickled vegetables.  Strangely, the meatball sandwich doesn't come with pate, so I ordered it with pate for an additional 25 cents. The meatball sandwich with extra pate and a can of grass jelly drink was just $5.  Where else can you get an awesome meal for $5?? That's an incredible deal, but more importantly the banh mi was delicious and I'll definitely be back.
author: Allen T.

description:
Best Banh Mi in the Tenderloin in my opinion. And $3.75!!

This review is after about 15 visits. Is it too hipster to say I've been eating here way before most of y'all have heard of it? 

From the bread to the pork, to the condiments, to the veggies. Just my favorite Banh mi around. Yes, it's better...way better than Saigon Sandwich 

Not a whole lot of room to sit down, the ambience is lacking but so what?

They have a frequent buyer card. Every 10(?) sandwiches gets you a free one.
author: Monsieur_Meursault _.

description: Yummy sandwiches & fresh spring rolls. Got to give props to this amazing mom & pop shop. I choose this place over Saigon sandwiches across the street.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Best banh mi I've had, served from the sweetest, most hard-working auntie I'll ever meet. I love it more than even the other shops across the street, which are arguably just as good, because the auntie who runs it brightens up the room when you step in.The bread is crunchy and soft, and the filling is hot, tangy, and bursting with umami. Make sure you try her pastries too!!

At $3.75 each and with vegan/vegetarian options, this place has won my heart for a life time.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Seems like a clean lil sandwich shop.  I'm here to try it out because sometimes the one across the street has stale bread.  Front desk lady seems nice but didn't offer me any promotions like the others ranted about.  We were 3 people but she didn't say buy 3 get 1 free so I'm not sure if that's still happening or just temporary.

  We just got one sandwhich the tofu one I'm crossing my fingers hope it's good will update tmr when I eat the sandwich.  The 4 star is for clean organized shop w/ good customer service since she separated my sandwich carrots and cilantro b/c I said it's not for eatting today.  

I think they should have a promo for new customers we were very hesitant of the purchase  so only got one.  If promo I would have gotten more for the rest of the family
author: Juila L.

description:
16.10.04     first visit of more to come
17.02.22     8th visit
17.02.26     featured on Sunday Chronicle!

I just placed this place as my TOP 5 Banh Mi
I don't give 5 stars out blindly ...
   Now several month later an article on
      SF Chronicle ... Congrats
I try to buy a banh mi every untried places 
     to save and compare ... Food treasure hunt.
Conservative estimate ... I tried 80÷ businesses
     In the bay area ... So I did have a large samples
     base for my review ...
My banh mi M.O.
     BBQ Pork or Combo
     I don't chase it down ... 
     Walk by ... Buy it ... Save it for later 
       (No matter before, after, full or empty stomach)
        ... I save at least 1 for later comparison to give
            A fair even assessment and KNOW which will
            Banh mi is good for future trips and outings.
            Sometimes like depth charges ... Bingo ...
            A HIT a WINNER ... hence why I try a new
            Restaurant when possible ... And of course 
            Return to it when possible ... Like fishermen  
            And crabbers.

More meat like Ty Sandwich.
Great balance of filling.
Very tasty ... Considering I ate this 14 hrs later.
Meaning ... The sandwich passed my tougher test.
    It didn't get soggy
    Naturally it won't be Crispy-Skin bun
    It can be brought for next day eating
    Yes ... For trips and outing
    Imagine if I ate on the spot ... Delicious

I believe Aaron ... Owner? ... Reponded to my review.
I love that ... Effort ...  Means the business do care 
     How it is doing ... and might react on strength and 
     weakness (traits of great businesses)

Can't wait to try all their sandwiches ...
      Especially the Chipotle one.

ROUGH DRAFT ...
author: S.K. Y.

description: WARNING! Just don't look at the neighborhood. I literally almost robbed in front of the store but kids thank goodness i'm a master at jujitsu  so the ass whipping they got was worth having a great sandwich afterwards. The Banh Mi sandwich was AMAZING!!!!!!!! It's cheap but quality made.   It is an extremely small shop. Too small to eat inside. I recommend ordering over the phone and or pick up or better yet Caviar or Uber eats. You will crave for another sandwich. I guarantee the addiction.
author: Shar I.

description: BEST VIETNAMESE SANDWICH IN SF! The marinated tofu with veggies is super fresh, amazing soft bread, and tons of vegetables. We came here on my sister's birthday because it's her favorite spot by her law school downtown. The family that own the shop are incredibly nice and quick with orders. For under $4 it is a crazy good deal in downtown SF. I am still dreaming of the flavor they pack into a little sandwich.
author: Lisa H.

description: Great sandwich place. I love that they have BBQ pork and chicken, which Saigon Sandwich does not offer. Also, they've started serving delicious home made crab noodle soup over the weekends for only $11!
author: Francis B.

description:
Update: 

They have banana tapioca pudding for $2. It was delicious and complimented the spicy special combo sandwich very well :)
author: Kayla O.

description:
Order delivery from here more than once a week. I ask for extra veggies and no mayo and they always COME THROUGH WITH THE EXTRA VEGGIES on the banh mi. 

Theyre spring rolls are huge and tasty with mint inside. They gave me sriracha packets on the side like I asked! =D
author: Chris L.

description:
Saw L&G across from Saigon Sandwich. L&G turned out to be better. L&G is now my favorite TL Banh Mi joint.  The couple that serves up the Banh Mi fare is very sweet,  as compared to the grumpy and harried crew at Saigon. 

3 of us sampling the meatball (siu mi), chicken and bbq pork versions. They all were good/great renditions. They had (and we got) a small variety of (Vietnamese) mochi, sweet/colored rice, and other goodies. The couple offered a "buy 10 get one free" cards to us and with the man saying "good deal" and stamped the back with 3 marks. I took the card but unfortunately I am not much of a coupon clipper or a disciplined carrier of frequent dining cards like this, so it likely won't be used on my return visits.

The story of the owner is worth reading : https://zip.kiva.org/loans/8004?invite=ylb2&utm_source=lender&utm_campaign=89037&utm_medium=social
author: Matsuo U.

description:
I don't get it...why do people stand in line for 1/2 an hour when there are some much better sandwiches across the street.  Yes L&G is so much better than Saigon Sandwiches and here's why:

*They pack their sandwiches with generous portions of meat and veggies (and jalapeno slices)
*The meat (I had the BBQ pork) is super tasty and hot
*The bread is warm
*The price is right ($3.75)
*They work fast
*They are friendly
*They have a punch card
*There is no line
*They have Vietnamese coffee

Goodness
author: Monkey B.

description:
1.  Look outside the window - Don't look at their counter, the way they make your banh mi, the uncovered plastic food containers with flies hovering.  Here around 9/24, cool weather so imagine on a warm day with likely more flies.

2.  Picture yourself on an island as u patiently wait for your sandwich - if you look at them and the food and the place, u wonder why u here on the first place.  The person who put your sandwich doesn't wear hair net.  The guy who wraps your sandwich in white sheet and put a rubber band around it doesn't wear gloves though he is also the cashier, meaning his hands touch $$$ and your food.

I got Roasted Chicken from Sai Gon right across the street and got BBQ Pork here.  This place tastes much better than the Sai Gon.  The BBQ Pork is crusty, crispy, and the BBQ pork was very tasty though a bit burned.  Has lots of veggies too.  One great thing compared to Sai Gon is they cut your bread from a long French baguette so your sandwich is much bigger than the other place.

3 stars instead of 4 bc of hygiene.
author: James G.

description:
Tried out L&G Vietnamese Sandwich Sun 2/22/15.  It has a Grand Opening sign out front and so I was excited to try a new place when I usually go for Saigon Sandwich nearby.

They have a small menu and picked the Special combo sandwich $3.75.  It was pretty fast to get my sandwich.

Tasted ok, lots of stuff inside, I thought the bread was a bit too hard and crunchy.

Guy told me he was going to lower the price to $3.25 for a month starting 2/24/15 so I might try something else next time.

I paid Cash.
author: Ann L.

description:
This is one of the best sandwich shops I've been to. The sandwiches are cheap, yet filling, the service is a plus, and the shop is never too crowded. 

Large groups are not recommend, but feel free to bring a friend or two. They're always be happy with more loyal patrons like myself.
author: Alvin T.

description:
This is my go-to for Vietnamese Sandwiches, which is saying a lot considering all the options there are in the Tenderloin, and even out in San Jose. The lady and her husband are extremely nice, and I believe she used to work at Them Ky around the block on Ellis, which previously had really good sandwiches, but I haven't been back for a while. Anyway, the highlights of this place are definitely the combination (Dac Biet) and the Banh Mi Ga.

The combo has 3 meats, a headcheese pork, bbq pork, and steamed pork cake, just as traditional combos have. The pate on the sandwich is quite good, and not overpowering or containing a lot of MSG. The chicken sandwich, in my opinion is better than Saigon Sandwich nearby, as the meat doesn't require any sauce to be poured over, and is marinated well with many spices. One of the best parts however, is when the sandwich is eaten fresh while the bread is still warm from the toaster. Their bread is a traditional french roll/baguette, but some of the stuffing has been ripped out. As such, you get a nice crispy outside, with just enough warm dough, while avoiding the heavy feeling of eating dense bread. 

The Vietnamese drip coffee (Cafe sua da) is quite good and strong, and is very quick because she has multiple french presses set up to drip so the coffee can be prepared quickly, unlike in most restaurants, where waiting for your coffee to drip can take ages. This place also has weekly specials, such as bun bo hue, and other things, which will be posted on a sign outside the door. I've also tried the spring rolls (Goi Cuon) and they are very tasty, because she uses marinated and grilled pork and chicken(Thit Nuong and also Ga), so you don't really even need the peanut sauce, although it's pretty good with it as well. Overall, a nice experience every time I come in. 

Some tips: If you want a little extra flavor, ask them to put Maggi soy sauce on the sandwich. They have stamp cards for a free sandwich after 10.
author: Jonathan D.

description: The Chipotle sandwich here is very addictive. One of the best vietnamese sandwich shops in the area. Even better than saigon sandwiches across the street.
author: Peter T.

description: this place so awesome for lunch ... diff meat choices and lots of sides they sell. everyone very nice & we should all support local small businesses everywhere.
author: Eugenia L.

description: This is the best sandwich in town. Owned by the nicest family. You get so much for your buck! Highly recommend. Their Tai ice tea with boba is also out of this world. Love this place.
author: Nicolas C.

description: I feel like this place is a little overshadowed by its competitors across the street, but this place is really good. Their sandwiches are a little more authentic than their competitors' and most importantly, I don't feel so rushed whenever I go there. I just chill there quietly and wait for my food, as opposed to awkwardly standing around almost yelling my orders.
author: Do P.

description: The combination special is the way to go!  The iced coffee is good too!  Very friendly service from a sweet little old Vietnamese-Chinese lady.  I'm a regular here!
author: Jimmy N.

description:
There were 2 short white strands of hair in the pork sandwich that I got (I ordered chicken). 

I  didn't realize I was given the wrong order until I bit into the sandwich. The pork meat did not look appetizing at all. The bread was too dense, unlike the crunchy and light french ones from other Vietnamese sandwich shops. Hate to knock mom and pop shops, like this one, but they need to watch what they're serving people. 

Despite another customer waiting behind me, the guy was on the phone the whole time that he made my sandwich and was in no hurry to serve us.
author: Ai N.

description:
Best bahn mi sandwiches ever! Took these tasty sandwiches to outside lands and they were perfect! For $3.50 you get something 10x better than what you'd get at outside lands for $10!!!!! 

Chicken has so much flavor and they don't skimp on the "veggies" (pickled carrots, daikon, jalapeño and cilantro). 

Pork is also wonderfully seasoned and tasty! 

Best of all- family owned. Mom is making the sandwiches and is just the sweetest thing. Her son is working the register and is so hospitable. They've been open for 6months and I promise every time I'm in town, I will go and see them. They deserve nothing but success!!!! Go and support them!!
author: caitybirdie B.

description:
Damn... 


Probably (one of) the best Vietnamese sandwich you can get in the city. 

Came here after a pool part at the Phoenix hotel across the street. 

Got a BBQ chicken sandwich. 

What else can I say?
author: Crisanto G.

description:
Super Friendly Cheerful Service. Very Social Owner Lady. Family run Shop. Very Tidy and Clean.

Came across it today. 5 months New.
$3.50 for Combination Pork.  
Cash Only.

Cute sandwhich. NEATLY packed and stuff with Goodness. Homemade special Pork. Great generous filling of meat and vegies.

I love pate and you can taste and see it oozing with everybite!!
Taste equally good cold hours later.

The Vietnamese palate in me is very happy!
They have all the vietnamese lunches and goosies.
Even tge Vietnamese fried rice with lots of that Chinese Ausafe la cheng pieces.

Got my favorite desert, the soybean rice with coconut cream, jae daow!;)

My favorite spot so far in the TL for my Vietnamese lunch and Banh Mi Fix!!

7:28
Just Tried the other Sandwhiches. Ordered 5 and they were made proptly with tons of goodies.

BBQ PORK us OMG!! A FLAVOR BLAST!!

Chicken and Tofu is Legit!
author: Hung L.

description: Saigon line was too long so I tried this little shop for chicken bahn mi. I would say it is just as good, so here's another great place for sandwiches if you are in the area.
author: Michele D.

description:
I usually go to Saigon Sandwich Shop which is across the block but I stumbled to this new place. I was kinda hesitant by reading the reviews here, thought F it I'll give it a try, ppl have different reviews and different taste buds.
The gentleman who made my sandwhich was very kind. The place is clean and stocked with homemade snacks from fresh egg rolls, sweet rice, etc. I ordered the combo Bahn mi. Took a bite of it and damn it was really good. No shade on meats and veggies. Prices is .25-.50 cent less than Saigon. I really don't know what ppl were saying that the bread is too crunchy. To me, it was perfect. 
If your are impatient waiting in a long ass line in Saigon Sand shop, give this place a try. It's worth it in my opinion.
author: Cee M.

description:
Nice, filling sandwich with very reasonable pricing. 

The bread was a bit too dense, thick, dry and on the hard-crusty side, not soft-crispy.

I had the combo sandwich, the meat was alright,not very flavorful - all cold cuts. Couldn't taste much of the pate or mayo. 
Pickles and cucumber were very fresh so that was good. The pickled carrots and radishes were not overly overwhelming or cut too thick like some places - awesome! But they do tend to give a lot of carrots which upstage the meat. :(

Nice togo brown bag with napkins included. 
Super friendly lady behind the counter.

Cash only, btw.
author: Châu B.

description: This place is a godsend. I have their sandwiches weekly and they're are fresh and amazing. The marinated tofu Bahn mi is seriously the best one I have ever had. And they are PACKED with veggies and super toasty. I will only get my sandwiches here from now on. Btw just had the Chipotle pulled pork bahn mi and man it was incredible.
author: Glenn G.

description: For $3.75 you really can't go wrong! The sandwich was filled generously and the lady serving me was very friendly! I didn't realise the food safety rating, I didn't get sick and the food seemed fresh enough to me... The surrounding area is very "colourful", so luckily there's a small area you can sit to eat your banh mi!
author: Tim S.

description:
L & G offers 5ish kinds of bahn mi, buy 3, get one free, buy one, get soda free.

eats: combo (3.75)
-nice baguette, meats not much taste
-sammie tasted of jalepenos, fish sauce, msg,  carrots, and vietnamese sauce

crumbs:
-maybe meatball would be better.
-parking difficult to find.
author: Victor G.

description: This place never disappoints.  When you ask them an extra of anything, they will add more than extra. My go to sandwich here is the chicken, always juicy and flavorful. I don't care on how ghetto the area is, when I'm around the area and hungry, their sandwich hits the spot!
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
This place has slipped past me, especially when they are right next to the great Saigon Sandwich. Long story short, this is a Great alternative to Saigon Sandwich. It's cheaper, quicker, and less crowd. 

It's a one-woman show here. She makes the sandwich and collects the money. She used gloves so its a very good thing. The chicken banh mi is really good and they give you a good amount. 

This will be my go-to Banh Mi spot when I am in the Tenderloin, which thank god I am not often. 

The only reason that it's not a 5-star is because I prefer a little more mayonnaise, pate, and a crunchier bread but those are subjective.
author: U L.

description: I came upon this place when Saigon was closed early thinking any sandwich will ease my bahn mi craving and boy am I glad Saigon closed early that day! L&G has the most delicious tofu sandwiches, just as good as Saigon and dare I say, may be even better! The tofu is seasoned well and really juicy while the bread is crunchy. The people there are really nice too and will ask you if you want mayo (I guess for the vegans) and they even have a punch card! They are slower in making the sandwiches since they might not be used to lines (yet) but it's definitely worth the wait.
author: Melissa C.

description: This place is the bomb.  I've been to Vietnam, but the sandwiches here are even better.  I would strongly recommend the BBQ pork, but just ask to women who runs the place for the specials of the day and she will hook you up.  No offense to the other Bahn Mi places in the neighborhood, but this one's the best I've had, at least since Mae sold her shop on Larkin.
author: Joe E.

description: Good sandwiches and the green jello taste good too. Authentic sandwiches. There are a lot of good snacks too.  Highly recommend.
author: Jack B.

description:
Newly opened banh mi shop kitty corner to another must-not-be-named sandwich shop. Bold move. I also think this is the cheapest banh mi that I've found anywhere in SF if not the Bay Area. For the price, this was pretty bomb. 

Being new, it's also fairly new inside. Upon entering, I was greeted by a very cheery aunty with a side smile. I ordered over the phone about 2 minutes earlier, and my order was ready for pickup by the time I arrived. There wasn't much of a line either. The prices looked like they dropped 25 cents from the photos I saw online. I wasn't complaining. I was briefly tempted by the snacks and desserts strategically placed in front of the cash register, but resisted and quickly paid the cash in exchange for my two sandwiches. Got a brown bag and some napkins to go with them; what a steal. 

The friendly aunty said thank you not only when I paid, but also when I exited. She's got my vote for sure. 

The sandwich was decently sized with the right type of bread. A quality banh mi for the price paid. As I leaned in for a bite, I slightly missed and the crust of the bread scratched my lips -- oow! That was one seriously toasted bread. I had to bit very carefully through the rest of the sandwich so as not to rip up my tongue or my lips. Other than that though, the sandwich was quite tasty. The pork was very well marinated and quite tender.
author: Audrey L.

description:
Best banh mi ever! Bread is toasted and crunchy on the outside, while still soft on the inside. And, yes, it's still warm! They pack in a lot of meat and all the other good stuff that goes in there. Prices are decent compared to shops in Sunset/Richmond. I don't know why it took me so long to come here. This is going to be my go-to place for banh mis from now on.

Just a few seats available in the small shop. Most people order to-go, but I've eaten there before with a few friends, and it was fine ... though not the most comfortable place to sit and chat for more than 20/30 minutes.
author: Ava C.

description: Unbeatable special combo Bahn Mi for $3.75! Like Saigon Sandwich across the street the bread is a bit dense and harder than I'm used to (they probably buy from the same bakery), but it's a great sandwich nonetheless. Stuffed with fillings and so good when it's warm. Walk down to Civic Center, find a seat, and have a nice, good, cheap lunch.
author: Mike L.

description: YUMMMM. had two tofu bahn mi delivered and the fiance and i scarfed 'em down like champs. this is a legit sandwich--not that jazzed up bs they're selling all over town with golden cauliflower puree and unicorn-harvested greens. all the right toppings (classic fried tofu, pickled carrots, tons of jalapeños, cool cucumbers and just enough mayo) stacked inside a perfectly toasted bun. just what we needed after our holiday in the midwest. will definitely order another round soon.
author: Amber S.

description: Sandwich is ok, similar to other banh mi places. Hygiene is horrific. In the middle of preparing my sandwich, the lady behind the counter answered the phone and proceeded to make my sandwich after hanging up. After glaring at her, she decided to put on 1 glove, but handling food with both. Disguting! Not going back.
author: Rachel C.

description:
One of the best sandwiches I have ever had in San Francisco! I ordered Combination Sandwich for 3.75!! a $3.75 and tastes heavenly! What a great combination of meat and fresh veggie. I wish I had taken the picture but I just couldn't stop savoring it after one bite. I will go there again!

Taste 5/5
Service 4.9/5
Price 5/5
author: Mana K.

description: Sandwich here is as good as Saigon sandwich from across the street. Best of all, it doesn't have those long lines. Highly recommended their BBQ pork sandwich n combi
author: Aniko N.

description: So gooddd. One of the best banh mis I've had. Definitely best in the area I've sampled lees sandwiches, balos, Saigon sandwiches, as well as several in various pho restaurants. Nothing better than being full with 3.75.
author: Edward H.

description:
The best Vietnamese sandwiches I tried in the bay so far. And yes, I'm including San Jose. 
It was a surprise hole in the wall, the meat was plenty and very well seasoned. The must try's are the bbq pork and meatball. Will come back again and again
author: Khoa V.

description:
I kept reading that Saigon Sandwich was the best banh mi in the city so that's where I kept going for my fix, even though it never really hit the spot. After a very average batch of sandwiches (I bought 4 at once and had to bitterly eat my way through them) I decided to try a couple of other places to see if anywhere was better.

I stopped as soon as I got to L&G - mission over! As soon as I took my first bite I couldn't stop smiling because THIS WAS IT. I haven't had a banh mi this good since I moved to the US! The buns are generously filled and the carrot is perfectly tart (which I feel SO strongly about and is SO hard to find here - most places err on the sweeter side). I always get the combo because it's what I grew up with.

The lady who works here is super sweet, they accept credit (!!!) and the loyalty cards are the icing on the cake. I'd still come here if the service were surly and cash-only but it's just nice that it isn't, you know?

This is by far the best banh mi I've had in San Francisco. I am so happy that L&G exists!
author: Kaye C.

description: Well today I found my new favorite Vietnamese sandwich shop!  I'm no stranger to ban mi and I have to say the L & G totally knocked it out of the park!  First of all, the roll was of proper size and arrived perfectly heated absolutely stuffed with meat and pickled veggies (a nice touch was a thinly sliced cucumber pickle along with the usual carrots and onions that had just the right amount of sweetness) and extra jalapeño if you wish.  To add to this, they have a punch card good for a free sandwich with every 10 you buy and at $3.75 this has to be one of the best deals in the city especially for the size ban mi you get.  As a side note, the people who own the shop are really nice too.  I absolutely recommend giving them a try!
author: Tom K.

description:
Don't look at this review. Please. It is not indicative of how often I come here. I don't need people knowing where I might happen to be and that I might happen to carry around cash (as this is a cash-only establishment.)

You do not need to know that they have delicious bread that is just the right amount of pillowy soft on the inside and hurt-your-mouth toasted on the outside. That's the sort of thing that carb-lovers care about. You're not into carbs, right? It's all about protein these days. 

Speaking of protein, I'm here for the pork. I can't speak for any of the other meats because I just come in for the same thing over and over: my overdue pork sandwich. They don't skimp on the meat as of way of tricking me to keep coming back. It works.

The pickled veggies and cilantro help me feel like I'm eating salad, which I should probably eat more of these days, but where the heck am I going to find a filling salad for less than $5?

Bonus points for the friendliness and the Jello. I never get the Jello but I like that it's there.
author: Loli L.

description: Best Viet sandwiches in SF in my opinion. Saigon sandwiches doesn't compare to this place. I usually get the BBQ pork, and there's a good portion of meat that comes in the sandwich. The bread is just right and they do not skimp out on ingredients
author: Linda H.

description: You can see L & G as you're waiting in line for world famous Saigon Sandwich.  Imho this place is just as good at least.  Seems to me that L G sandwiches aren't as sweet as Saigon, which makes it preferable to me.
author: paul a.

description:
Cheap Vietnamese sandwiches but also super good and filling!! 
DO NOT GET THE COMBINATION SANDWICH THOUGH. The meat was bad and filled with fat. 

The chicken sandwich on the other hand was amazing! They did not skimp on the toppings even though the sandwich was only about $4-$5! 

The neighborhood is pretty disgusting and smelly but the sandwiches here are definitely a 5 star!
author: Jessica W.

description: i have eaten at l&g at least 10 times and always enjoyed my sandwich and the nice people i've encountered.  why only 3 stars?  because the place needs to be closed for two days and CLEANED.  i'm afraid until the place improves it's score with the board of health i will no longer be a customer.  yesterday we sat at the counter and looked out through a filthy window, after cleaning the counter.  it hurts me to say this because we think the food is good and the lady there is very sweet and accommodating, but you're serving food and the place should reflect that.
author: Alexandria B.

description:
My new go to spot for banh mi.  

Prices are from 10 years ago and look and taste just like Saigon Sandwiches across the street.
author: Vance T.

description: This is the best roast pork sandwich I have ever had.They put a slab of cucumber,amazing.I wish I was in that neighborhood more often.I have had the chicken as well but I love the pork more.Think about it Starbucks coffee costs more than this real food.You got veggies,bread,meat.
author: I. W.

description:
My tofu sandwich was not good. I think the primary issue was the mayonnaise, which tasted largely like what you would buy at an American grocery store rather than what should be in a banh mi. What the heck!! The bread was also not crunchy, though the owner explained that they had run out and needed to purchase some from another sandwich place.

I also typically get a taro/sago pudding cup, and this one tasted weird. Kind of salty? Definitely not normal, as I've eaten a ton of these in the past and the flavor was quite off.

I have the will to like this place, but really can't rate it high in good conscience!
author: Shendi X.

description:
This place faces stiff competition from Saigon Sandwich a few yards away, but I am an Equal Opportunity Eater and gave it a shot. It's never been crowded when I've been here and the people are friendly. The guy at the register caught me off guard the first time I walked in, striking up a conversation with me as I was daydreaming about consuming my sandwich. If you like your bread crunchy, you'll like their sandwiches. Me personally, I prefer a softer roll (my only knock on this place). However, the sandwiches contents really make this place shine. The meat has a perfect level of spice and is nice and moist. 

It generally come down to which light allows me to walk when I decide between this place and Saigon, though their sandwich is 50¢ cheaper.
author: Michael G.

description:
So friendly :D 
I love this lady ! 
I visited couples times already, and I fell in love with them on my first visit.
I ordered combination one with extra pate. The lady said do not worry, I wont charge you for extra pate. Thats when i instantly fell in love with this place. haha

I got my sandwihch, came back home and wow
It was pretty amazing. I loved it. Tons of pate, and all meat had so much flavors. I just loved it all. Nothing to complain about. I think this is my new fav place to get bahn mi now.. even if Saigon Sandwich is pretty good... this place is ALSO good just as much as Saigon Sandwich. 
Try it. I bet you will fall in love just like how i did :)
author: Yumi K.

description:
Food:
Combo banh mi = pretty good! Bread is a little tough tho 


Service:
Nice Vietnamese family :) CASH ONLY. Atm at across the street at corner store 

Atmosphere:
Very small takeout standard viet sammich take out with spring roll and shrimp chip snacks on table
author: Angela L.

description: Staying at the hotel across the street, we asked the front desk which Bahn Mi place they recommended (there are two within a block), and they suggested L&G.  My husband and I both ordered the BBQ pork sandwich and we loved it!  My husband orders a Bahn Mi whenever he gets the chance and he was in heaven!  The woman who runs the hole in the wall is an absolute delight!  We asked what a certain unrecognizable (to us) food was and she was so excited to let us try it, she gave us the whole package for free when we said we really liked it!  I still don't know what the moist yellow thing was, but it was delicious and she said she had made it that morning. My husband and I have eaten in a lot of foodie spots in SF, and while this is definitely NOT one of those, the sandwich and the whatever-that-thing-was were EXCELLENT in flavor and did not disappoint!!
author: Jody T.

description: $3.25 for a bbq chicken banh mi and $3.50 for bbq pork! Friendly people, clean for the TL, and tasty. They will warm up the bread in a little oven before making your sandwich on it. I think these prices are only temporary, but I'm sure they will be price competitive with Saigon Sandwich even after. Bonus for being open later than SS, too. I think this shop may be my new TL sandwich go-to place, woot.
author: Linus W.

description: THIS PLACE IS SO UNDER RATED. Saigon sandwich had a line outside the door (as always) so I decided to try here. This place is so much better than Saigon!!!! Unlike Saigon, their bread is crispy but soft, not soggy. Saigon's meat to bread ratio is not on point, there's much too much meat that it feels as if im not even eating a sandwich anymore. L&G's ratio is perfect!! Stop eating at Saigon! You have to try here, it's amazing, and clean! They even have stamp cards and combination pork sandwiches
author: Lashondraneesha W.

description: I'm accustomed to longer baguette bahn mi in San Diego but this place is good.  I was told that Saigon Sandwiches is better but I have to disagree.  L&G had better bread, although similar, and the spread was more savory.  Good ratio of bread, meat, and veggies.   I got the Combo/special.  Delicious.
author: Ryan K.

description: Wonderful banh mi sandwiches! The price is great--nearly impossible to find a cheaper sandwich in this city--and they're delicious and a good size. Plus, the owners are very kind and friendly. AND they do punch cards for a free sandwich! Highly recommend.
author: Lara H.

description: Cmon now,  $3.50 for a really damn good pork sandwich?  What more can I say? The sandwich was so damn good. I would definitely go back again and again.
author: david p.

description: A friend recommended this place and i just had to try it while i was in the area. This place is wayyyy better than saigon sandwiches. I ordered the cold cut banh mi and the cuts of meat in that sandwich was dangerously delicious. It had the right amount of pate in it and a hint of maggi sauce. The bread was perfect when i got home and toasted it, the inside of the bread was fresh and soft. Oh and the owner was super nice too, apparently they serve different noodle soups on the weekends. I would love to give their bun bo hue a try.
author: Carmen A.

description: One of the best bahn mi's around. The bread is perfect and the toppings are super fresh. The people who own it are also very nice. It's my go to bahn mi spot in SF
author: Bret C.

description:
Hands down the best Vietnamese sandwich I've ever eaten. My friend and I did a taste test, where we bought one sandwich from L&G and one from Siagon (love that place too). Anyway, we both chose L&G! I have gone back to both several times to be sure it wasn't just an "on" day for one and "off" day for the other. 

I'm a fat man; we, overweight-Americans, are stereotypically experts on things that taste delicious.
author: Tony D.

description: 15 sandwiches later....I can say L&G's bbq chicken is consistently moister and more tender than the big competitor across the street.  I'm enjoying one now as I write this.
author: rb l.

description: The best. Seriously. The best. The fried tofu sandwich is amazing and only $3.50, and their bread is always fresh.
author: Derek S.

description: They have very good sandwiches and this shop can be my stop every morning. Because I live just 2 blocks away, and it's so convenient.
author: Kelly N.

description: Delicious bread, meat n veggies, perfect size sandwich, so affordable, other great snacks available, friendly owner and the only Vietnamese place on that block with a good health score! This place rocks!
author: She Ra L.

description: Really great, one of the best I've had in the bay area. Just taking a star away for the quality of the bread, little lacking in flavor and freshness.
author: Sistrsprkl S.

description:
I only post a review when I find a place to be pretty exceptional, and L&G has impressed me with their quality and consistency.

I'm vegetarian, so I can only attest to the tofu sandwich, but I was quickly hooked on it. The tofu is delicious and plentiful, the pickled vegetables are delicious with just the right crunch, and the bread is always been fresh. The sandwiches never fall apart and are consistently assembled with an appreciable proportion of tofu to veggies to spice. 

The folks who run L&G are great, service is always fast, and the order (no mayo) is always right. Incredible deal for $3.25, so remember to tip!
author: Jordan A.

description: The best bahn mi in the city!   I've tried all the vietnamese sandwich shops around and L&G has the perfect mix of flavors (tasty meats/veggies) and texture (bread that is crunchy on the outside but moist and soft on the inside).    Fast, pleasant service and a great price.   I especially recommend the bbq chicken and meatball banh mi...
author: Super T.

description:
Banh Mi, but don't ban me from Banh Mi for this review!!!!  

My family and I love Banh Mi Vietnamese sandwiches and this one is TOPS in our hearts and palates.

When I happened upon this new place one day in the Tenderloin after getting my car fixed nearby, I never looked back!  Incredible taste symphony of some sweet and some savory with texture crunch with color variety presentation of beautiful green, orange and perfectly toasted baguettes.  

My family and I favor the meatball sandwich and it's auto-magic for us to head there and happen to find parking and order to eat there, if there's seating, or pick up on the go.

I don't have pictures, because we devour them and they're sitting in our bellies, but you can see ample visual treats here on Yelp, anyway.

About the business... 

It's totally a family Mom and Pop run business that opened earlier this year. 

Aside from the tasty eats, we always get treated very nicely by the owner and her family -- husband and their 2 sons. and they're totally vested and lived in the neighborhood for 20 years.  

Here's their story and in, particular the "Mom" Ki, who is the chef creator of these tasty sammies: https://zip.kiva.org/loans/8004?invite=ylb2&utm_source=lender&utm_campaign=89037&utm_medium=social

Get L & G Banh Mi in me belly!!!

Enjoy, Yelpers!  Tell your friends!

Additional Note:  They take credit cards now, but will cost a little more than cash price.
author: Robin S.

description: Good Vietnamese fast food. The best part is it's family run. The lady that runs it is always happy to see people come in.
author: Dan R.

description: My favorite banh mi place in the Tenderloin. The woman who makes the sandwiches always greets me with a "hello sister", which makes it feel like a very friendly place. I like the sandwiches better than at Saigon (which, like some other places around here, includes onion - blech) and I always feel a bit superior when I am walking past that place on my way back to the office, tasty L&G sandwich in hand. I've only tried the chicken and tofu so far, but they're both great.
author: Nicole B.

description: Hits the spot on taste and portion. Nice place for a nice portion of meat at a very reasonable price.  This place improved a lot on taste, portion, and food preparation.  Staff appears very friendly and positive.
author: Tommy K.

description: I was walking down the neighborhood and I stumbled upon the grand opening sign so I said to myself "why not?"  I stepped inside and the menu was nice and big; good thing too because I forgot my glasses that day. A strapping young man greeted me as a got in and asked me how my day was. Usually I just say "I'm fine" but i was actually having a hard day and I just told him and he actually seemed to care and just by that action, it gave comfort that these people are running a local business with such a kind heart. I ordered a lemongrass chicken sandwich and it was so good I bought 2 more and finished it on spot. The food is good, the vibe is cozy. I know I'm coming here again and again... And again.
author: Marco M.

description: This the best of the vietnamese sandwiches that I've ever eaten. My favorite is the pork.  I try to buy two days worth of meals, about twice each month, since they opened.
author: Donald W.

description: I pass this place once a week and never stopped until today. WOW, what a great little joint ! I love the "mom and pop, hole in the wall" feel to it......and the sandwich is delicious and cheap.The husband and wife team were really sweet and helpful.Now, once a week,I'll be stopping here to get a great sandwich from some great people !
author: TJPHX T.

description:
I got a combination Bahn Mi - was really good. I admit that I'm no expert on what makes a great one vs a bad one - I've tried Saigon Sandwich and Duc Loi, and liked those too.

This one was just as good as the others I've had. Also, the people working there were super nice, the place was clean, the price was cheap. Overall, an enjoyable lunch.
author: Jon B.

description: Nice family-owned Vietnamese sandwich shop. Got the marinated tofu sandwich & a freshly made  Vietnamese iced coffee. Good sandwich, fresh, nice amount of marinated veggies. One of the better Tofu Bahn Mi in the neighborhood.
author: Wan T.

description:
Was in San Francisco for the weekend and wanted to try some Vietnamese sandwiches, which are a rare find in DFW.  Great price for the food and was expecting it to be much more in this part of the country.  

Staff was friendly and service was impeccable! 

Will return on my next trip!
author: Kevin L.

description: My boyfriend and I are big fans of their sandwiches, really cute place so check it out! Everything tastes super fresh and authentic and they definitely don't skimp on their meat yaaay!
author: Beatrice W.

description: My friend recommended this place to me cause I was in the neighborhood and was craving some Vietnamese sandwiches. As soon as I walk in, the workers are extremely welcoming and friendly. I got the special combination and the sandwich and it was packed with ingredients. For just $3.75, who can say no to that? I will definitely be back for more
author: Angela L.

description: I think this is my first vietnamese sandwich. My friend and I got the combination sandwich. The french baguette, meat, and vegetables (consisting of carrot, lettuce, jalepeno, cilantro, amd cucumbers) created a nice harmony in taste and texture.
author: Joey C.

description: Of the 3 reviews I've written for the pork combo banh mi at this intersection of Eddy and Larkin, I like L&G's the best. It's a modest shop, clean with a few seats at the window-side counter. They sell a few other homemade goodies like your typical fresh rolls and even oily rice. The sandwich here is made using baguettes that I'll say are the most traditional in terms of size and texture compared to the others (based on my vast experience of having consumed banh mi at only maybe a dozen restaurants in my lifetime, so not saying much). My biggest gripe with Lee's was their roast pork; here, the roast pork has good consistency and flavor and, while not as overwhelming in quantity as at Saigon Sandwich, you get a good amount of protein between that, the pate and the pork roll. While the veggies don't come pickled, they sprinkle a little vinegar on your sandwich which offers the proper acid to cut the protein and fat; the added kick from the dash of either soy or Maggi sauce nicely complements the mayo. If you're at this intersection and looking for the best traditional pork combo based on proportion of ingredients and overall taste, my money goes to L&G.
author: Gene C.

description: I love this place. The sandwiches are fantastic and the workers there are extremely friendly. I've tried many Vietnamese sandwich places and this one caught me by surprised. Anyone who goes to this place SHOULD, I repeat, SHOULD get meatball. I'm Vietnamese so I know good banh mi.
author: Sandon T.

description: Yummy! Authentic food for a great price! The lemon grass chicken is my most fave. Love that little zestyness :)
author: Marian M.

description: Cute little place with excellent customer service! The owner is super sweet and adorable. Definitely will be coming back. Sandwiches were pretty delicious!
author: C D.

description: The sandwiches here are really good! The prices are super cheap to :) a cute little place!
author: Lucenda D.

description: good food, and good service. remember that ask owner the card for loyal customer. buy 10 get 1 free
author: Sloan L.

description: I have to say although there's other places around you can't beat that they treat you like family here! I brought my son over the first time to check it out and he loved it. He felt so comfortable playing with the lady over the counter and when we left he cried because he didn't want to leave. The lemon grass chicken is the bomb! With some spring rolls for later it's all must have!
author: Harold N.

description: this place has easily become the best vietnamese sandwich in the city if not all of nor cal.. yes it beats out the crappy made sandwiches across the street at saigon sandwich, sing sing and lees as well. i have lived in the neighborhood for over 30 years and have seen alot of sandwich places come and go. . L&G is basically doing what their competition used to do which is put out a quality sandwich. i know this place will be around for a long time as long as their quality stays and their competition keeps slacking. the sandwiches can easily beat out the best from san jose and oakland as well no problem.
author: Art N.

description: YUMS! I mean, super yum! I have been to the real spot, VietNam 3 times and this is the real deal. The bread was super, soft inside with an awesome crunch. The veggies were fresh as can be.  One could only ask for a bigger stomach. I will be back here for sure!
author: April M.
